item.title: From: Martin Chandler, To: Elijah H. Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Martin Chandler, To: Elijah H. Chandler Mailed From: Milwaukee on November 30, 1922

Mr. E.H. Chandler 2018 Newland Ave. Chicago, Ill.

Milwaukee Nov. 30 Dearest Everyone, Though I'd better write few lines right away as I just had a letter from Bess and Knox saying mama intended to visit me and I wanted to tell her that I've moved again. They transferred me to ward 11, annex 2 Wednesday evening. I didn't even get an examination at general hospital. Guess Mama is there now. Sure will be glad if she can come up. Hope some of you can come up. Hope some of you can come with her. I don't know what they're figuring on doing with me. I feel fine and dandy. I'm afraid my compensation claim will get a set back if the diagnosis made here stands. 'Course I wont care if the diagnosis is correct. Naturally, I'd rather be free from TB than have the pay. We had good dinner yesterday. I'll enclose the menu. I'm the afternoon a lot of us went to football game, Marquette vs. Ames, Marquette winning 6 to 0. We had passes. I had a notion to ask for pass to come down there for Thanksgiving but when they transferred me Wednesday evening, I didn't have a chance, as the doctor on this ward was gone Thanksgiving day. I like this ward better than any I've been in so far. Only two beds in each room and the rooms are nice. We ear at Annex 1, only a block away. Eat in general dining room. Mama when you come up, take the north shore line. Get off at 1st Ave and National Ave. Thats a regular hop on the North Shore line. Then you catch a National Ave. car, which would bring you right up in front of our place. Or else if you'll let me know what time you'll be here, and how you're coming, I'll meet you down town. I don't expect to be here very long. I don't think there's anything wrong with my thyroid gland, and if I haven't got I want to get out. The American Legion, Wisconsin Department, sent each man here a check for $1 yesterday. There's about 500 here. I squandered mine on a show after the football game. Russ, I stopped in at journal yesterday. Scott was only man on duty. He said HJD got beat up and was in hospital. That so? He hadn't heard that WS got slugged. He showed me a letter he had written to PDP asking for a raise. Grammatically, it was a farce. Well, I'm out of paper so will sign off. Mama, you be sure to let me know when you are coming. Love to all, Mart. Ward 11 Annex 2

item.title: From: Liam, To: Elijah H. Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Liam, To: Elijah H. Chandler Postcard Info: Co-Mo Foto Co., Watertown, Wis. Picture Info: Main Street East Dunlap IA. 08250 Mailed From: Dunlap, Iowa on June 5, 1921

Mr. Elijah H. Chandler Pearl, Illinois

6/4 Sat. Got here about 7 pm. Had a good trip in two days, and everybody O.K. Just drove 8 hours to Crepo looking for girls. Will write soon. Hello to all, Liam Mrs. Rush mentioned that she is getting along O.K.

item.title: From: Lorie, To: Elijah H. Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Lorie, To: Elijah H. Chandler Mailed From: Pana, Illinois on May 28, 1921

Mr. Elijah H. Chandler Pearl, Illinois

Pana, Illinois Dear Folks, We are going to try and make it and hop off tomorrow a.m. Will try and be there tomorrow night but do not know for sure. It may be Monday a.m. Love to all, Lorie Also, it is quite a city. Tell Grace and Ruby, if there, to go along.

item.title: From: Jacksonville State Hospital, To: Elijah H. Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Jacksonville State Hospital, To: Elijah H. Chandler Mailed From: Jacksonville, Ill. on December 16, 1920

Mailing Address: Mr. E.H. Chandler Pearl, Illinois

Return Address: After 5 days, return to 1201 S. Main St. Jacksonville, Ill.

Mr. E.H. Chandler, Pearl, Illinois. My Dear Sir: Your communication with reference to your daughter, Annie Chandler, received and in reply beg to state we do not think it advisable for her to leave the institution at this time, however if you desire to have her paroled defiantly in order that she may be taken out of the institution and provided for, we will be glad to have you write us to that affect. By taking the patient home for a few days only, we do not think the reaction is for the benefit of the patient and we will have to respectfully decline your request. Very truly yours, E. L. Hill Managing Officer

item.title: From: Martin Chandler, To: Elijah H. Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Martin Chandler, To: Elijah H. Chandler Mailed From: Newport News, Va. on April 7, 1919

Corp. MW. Chandler 6th Casual Co Camp Hill - Va. Newport News

Mr. E.H. Chandler Pearl, Ill. Pike County

Hill, Va. 6th Casual Co. April 7th, 1919 Dearest Papa, Mama, and all Well guess I'm stuck here until next week - there is a shipment of men going out of here Saturday for Illinois and I tried to get in with them but they said it was full up and said I'd probably get out of here next week - Golly but it makes me sore. Here it is only Wednesday and I'll probably be here until next wednesday. I heard over in germ nay that they were discharging men 24 hours after their arrival in the US. I landed here the 27th and wont be out until about the 14th of this month. I don't see why in the dickens I can't go with that bunch Saturday. This sure is a rotten camp. Don't get hardly anything to eat -I'd like to tell this Newport News bunch just what I think of them. Don;t do a blessed thing but lay around all day in this darned camp. Lordy - I wish I was home. I get so sore every time I think about staying here another week that I'd like to cuss the whole bunch. Write me here. Think probably it will reach me before I leave. I haven't written Grace and Lorin since landing cause I don't know their address. Certainly hope you are all well. Guess I'll be home someday. Lots of Love, Martin 6th Casual Co Camp Hill Newport News, Va.

item.title: From: Martin Chandler, To: Elijah H. Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Martin Chandler, To: Elijah H. Chandler Mailed From: France on December 20, 1918

Corp. M.W. Chandler US Army

Mr. E.H. Chandler Pearl, Ill.

Town, Dec 20, 1918 Dearest Papa, Mama, and all, Well I'm still in Casual Camp here and from looks of things I'll be here Christmas. Just my darn luck. I wouldn't mind so much if I had my mail and pay. I'd sure love to get my mail. Don't know where we go when we leave here. I've been in Casual Camp almost two months now. We had our first snow yesterday but didn't snow very long. Having pretty cold weather and theres no place to keep warm except in bed. Got a pretty good barn to sleep in. Lord I sure wish i was on my way. See in the papers every day about President Wilson. He got quite a reception over here. I'd like to see Paris before I go home. May have a chance to go later on. If we go back to our outfits I don't think will start home before middle of summer. I've been doing Company's clerical work in Casual Company. Don't have much to do. It rains everyday here. Makes it nice and muddy all the time. I wouldn't mind anything if I could only get my mail. Don't know of anything I'd rather have for Christmas than my mail. They might possibly ship us home as Casuals in which event we would be home this winter. Hope they do. I'm anxious to find out how Ruby is - no mail since 10th of October. Suppose Margaret Lucerne and Bess will be home for Christmas. Lord It's been a long while since I spent a Christmas at home. Last Christmas I was on the Atlantic. Well I'll make up for last time when I do get back cause I'm sure going to stick around home. Well must close for this time. Hope this finds all of you well. I'm feeling ok. Will write again soon. Think will find out when we go by Monday. Lovingly, Martin Corp M.W. Chandler. Co "C" 117 FBSC AEF

item.title: From: Martin Chandler, To: Elijah H. Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Martin Chandler, To: Elijah H. Chandler Mailed From: France, on December 16, 1918

Corp. M.W. Chandler US Army

Mr. E.H. Chandler Pearl, Ill.

France Dec. 16 Dearest Folks, Just couple of lines while in Town. Am still in Casual Camp about 5 kilometers from here. Don't know yet what they are planning to do with us. Am enclosing Christmas and New Years cards. The Cathedral is some shot up but a very pretty building. This is a town about size of Springfield. Sure am anxious to get my mail and pay. Today is Knox's birthday - wish I could send him something but only have couple francs. Will write you soon. Lovingly, Martin Corp M.W. Chandler Apo 715 Co "C" 117 FBSC AEF

From:Â Unknown, To: Elijah H. Chandler Mailed From: Cincinnati, Ohio on November 8, 1918

Mr. E.H. Chandler Pearl, Illinois

Cincinnati, Ohio 11/1/18, Time: 5:45 My train leaves 7 pm for Magsully. There is where I guess we will meet. Will be able to be home each night except Thursday. Fine traveling on Ohio River, 6000 purple. Will try and bring Grace a map or so you will have to have your Bess read to Maysville. I guess nice people and I believe there all like me O.K. Again later

item.title: From: Bess Chandler, To: Elijah H. Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From:Â Bess Chandler, To: Elijah H. Chandler Mailed From: Washington, DC on January 30, 1918 (Letter was originally sent to Bess Chandler from Martin Chandler on December 20, and then sent to Elijah H. Chandler from Bess Chandler on January 30, 1918)

Mr. E.H. Chandler Pearl, Ill USA

Dec 20th Dearest Bess, Received your dandy letter this am and the invitation to Ruby's wedding and sure glad to get them. Only wish I could be there. We were scheduled to leave yesterday but wont leave until Saturday now on account headquarters haven't got all their stuff loaded. We're sure going across this time though. I'm sorry I haven't had any pictures taken but its too late now. Didn't draw any pay last paw day so I've been broke. We might possibly get paid in Hoboken before leaving there and if we do I'll sure have some taken and have them sent home. Lordy wish I could be home for Christmas. This will make about 4 Xmas' I've missed at home. Guess you all have been pretty busy sewing and getting ready for the wedding. Glad to hear Grove has a good job. Hope he stays with it. I received Papa's letter last night. Sorry to hear they are going to take off the Helper. Well Bess don't know a whole lot to write. We haven't any thing to do now except wait for orders to embark. All of our horses and boxes have gone. Sure hope you all enjoy a merry Christmas and happy New Year. I'd like to have had another one of those angel good cakes before leaving but no chance now. Think they are pretty strict about sending anything to France. Will write soon as we get over. Love, Martin

On back of last page: Was mistaken about this being the letter which spoke of this instance. It was the letter he wrote before this one to me. When you find it wish you'd send it to me. I want to see what he said about it too. Bess

item.description:
From: Bess Chandler, To: Elijah H. Chandler Mailed From: Morrisonville, Illinois on December 7, 1917

Mr. E.H. Chandler Pearl, Illinois

Dearest Folks, Didn't send that good as I didnt love the braid. Have sent David Loutcuer, so will send it as soon as I get braid. We are all still busy sewing. Expect to start home next Wednesday. Lots of love, Bess
